member.name: T:IniFile.Config.HashCommentConfig
member.summary: Configuration on whether the hash symbol (#) can be used for comments.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether comments prefixed with a hash (#) symbol are allowed, in addition to the standard semi-colon ones.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether comments are to be prefixed with a hash (#) symbol by default, instead of the standard semi-colon.
Note that semi-colon prefixed comments will still be allowed.

member.name: T:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig
member.summary: Global configuration for reading and writing to INI files.

member.name: P:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig.HashForComments
member.summary: Configuration for using hash symbols (#) for comments in INI files.

member.name: P:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig.Padding
member.summary: Configuration for padding defaults for sections, properties and comments in INI files.

member.name: M:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig.AllowHashForComments(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows the hash symbol (#) to be used to prefix comments.
member.param: Sets the default comment prefix to the hash symbol (#).
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: T:IniFile.ErrorMessages
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.IniFileDoesNotExist
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The INI file '{0}' does not exist..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.InvalidMajorItemName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified name is not valid. A valid name can start with any alphabetic character, period (.), dollar symbol ($) or semi-colon (:) and can be followed by one or more alpha-numeric characters, underscores (_), tilde (~), dash (-), period (.), semi-colon (:), dollar symbol ($), or space..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.PropertyWithoutSection
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The property '{0}' is not in a section. This is not allowed; all properties must be specified under a section..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.StreamNotReadable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified stream is not readable (CanRead = false). The INI content cannot be loaded from it..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.StreamNotWritable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified stream is not writable (CanWrite = false). The INI object cannot be saved to it..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.UnrecognizedLine
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An unrecognized line was encountered in the INI content. {0}.

summary.para: In-memory object representation of an INI file.
This class is a read-only collection of objects.

summary.para: Base class for the major INI items, namely the and .
Each major INI item can have zero or more comments and blank lines.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique name of the INI item.
Collection of strings that represent the comments and blank lines of the INI item. If the string is null, an empty string or a whitespace string, then a object is created, otherwise a is created.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified name is null.

member.summary: The unique name of the or the .

summary.para: Represents details of the padding of an INI item, such as a , , and a .
Padding is used to represent the exact formatting of the INI item in the object model.
